nodes.name: Misleading causal inferences from regression analysis in social-science research
nodes.description: Quantitative studies depending on linear regression often publish causal claims that later prove false because of hidden specification errors.
nodes.node_rationale: Central risk emphasised: regression misuse leads to wrong answers (opening paragraph).

nodes.name: Subtle methodological flaws in regression specification in empirical studies
nodes.description: Choices such as axis inversion, irrelevant covariates or multicollinearity can silently distort coefficients and predictions.
nodes.node_rationale: The post lists multiple examples where small specification issues created large errors.

nodes.name: Axis selection ambiguity generating opposite regression conclusions in scatterplots
nodes.description: Switching which variable is treated as predictor vs response can flip the sign and magnitude of estimated effects.
nodes.node_rationale: Illustrated by Aaron Rodgers salary scatterplot example.

nodes.name: Statistical artifacts producing meaningless coefficients in time-zone regression
aliases: spurious coefficients in NBA time-zone study
nodes.description: Regression on team performance vs time-zone distance yielded coefficients lacking interpretable meaning due to artifact structure.
nodes.node_rationale: Exposed in Birnbaum’s NBA time-zone deconstruction.

nodes.name: Coefficient misinterpretation due to multicollinearity between OBP and SLG indicators
nodes.description: High correlation between on-base percentage and slugging percentage makes separate coefficients unstable and misleading.
nodes.node_rationale: Discussed across OBP/SLG regression puzzle parts I–V.

nodes.name: Detailed deconstruction of regression mechanics exposes hidden assumptions
nodes.description: Working through algebra, data ordering, and diagnostic plots uncovers why a model behaves unexpectedly.
nodes.node_rationale: Birnbaum repeatedly demonstrates that only deep dives reveal the true cause of failure.

nodes.name: Systematic audit of regression models to identify specification flaws
nodes.description: Instituting a checklist-based, step-by-step evaluation aimed at uncovering axis, variable and multicollinearity errors before publication.
nodes.node_rationale: Logical next step from insight: codify deconstruction into routine practice.

nodes.name: Manual step-by-step recreation and sensitivity analysis of regression pipelines
nodes.description: Researchers recreate the entire analysis, swap axes, drop variables, and examine coefficient stability to detect fragility.
nodes.node_rationale: Matches Birnbaum’s methodology across case studies.

nodes.name: Automated diagnostic tooling for regression axis, collinearity and coefficient-stability checks
nodes.description: Software runs standard diagnostics (VIF, axis swap simulations, coefficient perturbation) and flags suspicious patterns.
nodes.node_rationale: Inferred mechanism to scale audits beyond manual analysis.

nodes.name: Birnbaum case studies reversing erroneous regression conclusions
nodes.description: Multiple blog posts where corrected analyses contradicted original published claims, validating the audit approach.
nodes.node_rationale: Provides empirical support that the audit process uncovers real errors.

nodes.name: Train researchers to perform comprehensive regression audits before publication
nodes.description: Develop workshops and curricula teaching manual deconstruction, sensitivity analysis and diagnostic interpretation to researchers.
nodes.intervention_lifecycle_rationale: Applies to human research workflow rather than specific ML model phases (implicit across examples).
nodes.intervention_maturity_rationale: Some training efforts exist but are informal; no systematic large-scale deployment (inferred).
nodes.node_rationale: Directly addresses need for widespread capability to run audits.

nodes.name: Develop automated regression diagnostic software integrated into research toolchains
nodes.description: Implement open-source packages that automatically compute VIF, perform axis swaps, and alert users to unstable coefficients during analysis.
nodes.intervention_lifecycle_rationale: Tool design and development occur at analysis-design stage.
nodes.intervention_maturity_rationale: Conceptual; specific tool not yet built within the data source (inference).
nodes.node_rationale: Scales identification of flaws without requiring expert manual effort.

nodes.name: Institute peer-review checklists enforcing regression robustness in academic journals
nodes.description: Journals require authors and reviewers to complete a standardized checklist covering axis choices, collinearity diagnostics and sensitivity analyses.
nodes.intervention_lifecycle_rationale: Policy intervention outside model development lifecycle.
nodes.intervention_maturity_rationale: Speculative policy suggestion; not yet adopted (inference).
nodes.node_rationale: Creates structural incentive for robust regression practice.
